item.title: Jaspy Software Environments (Python 3, R and other tools)
item.description: This page provides details of the “Jaspy” software environments that provide access to Python 3, R and a range of other tools on JASMIN.

item.title: Running R on JASMIN
item.description: On the JASMIN sci servers and LOTUS, we support the use of R through the “jasr” environment(s), as listed on the Jaspy page.

item.title: Community Software: ESMValTool
item.description: ESMValTool is installed on JASMIN as a community package. This article provides: a brief overview of the ESMValTool software a description of the main features of the tool a quick-start for using ESMValTool on JASMIN links to further information Overview of ESMValTool   The Earth System Model Evaluation Tool (ESMValTool) is a community diagnostics and performance metrics tool for the evaluation of Earth System Models (ESMs) that allows for routine comparison of single or multiple models, either against predecessor versions or against observations.

item.title: Conda environments and Python virtual environments
item.description: Introduction   This article describes two types of software environments that you can create in order to install packages for your own use on JASMIN.

item.title: Creating and using miniconda environments
item.description: On JASMIN, we provide a wide range of packages via the Jaspy environment (which is itself a Conda environment). This page gives detail on how to create and use your own personal Conda environments via the miniconda installer, as an alternative to the use of Jaspy.

item.title: The Numerical Algorithm Group (NAG) Library
item.description: This article introduces the Fortran and C library of software under the Numerical Algorithm Group (NAG) license. NAG Library is a collection of robust, documented, tested and maintained numerical algorithms.

item.title: Python Virtual Environments
item.description: This article describes how you can use “virtual environments” to install Python packages that are not provided in the common software environments on JASMIN.

item.title: JASMIN software FAQs
item.description: Why do I have to load/activate a software environment? We have a range of different users on JASMIN who work on many different projects.

item.title: IDL and MIDL
item.description: This article explains how to: use the IDL software on JASMIN run these tools on the scientific analysis servers and LOTUS make efficient use of the IDL licences use the MIDL software on JASMIN - NOW DEPRECATED What is IDL?

item.title: Software Overview
item.description: JASMIN is a large platform where a range of software tools, packages and environments are available. Many users employ software already installed on JASMIN whilst some need to install their own tools for a particular purpose.

item.title: Postgres databases on request
item.description: This article explains that users may request access to a PostgreSQL (known as Postgres) database on JASMIN for use with scientific workflows.

item.title: The "jasmin-sci" software environment
item.description: This article describes the “jasmin-sci” software environment on JASMIN. It covers the following topics: Overview of the “jasmin-sci” software environment Activating and deactivating the “jasmin-sci” environment Using the “jasmin-sci” environment with Jaspy Overview of the “jasmin-sci” software environment   The jasmin-sci software environment is intended as a supplement to Jaspy and contains extra software packages for use with scientific data analysis which, for various reasons, are not provided as part of Jaspy itself.

item.title: Running python on JASMIN
item.description: On the JASMIN analysis machines and on Lotus, we support Python2.7 and Python3.7 through Jaspy. When you log in, the default version of Python is 2.

item.title: Using Matplotlib for visualisation on JASMIN
item.description: This article provides a basic example of using Matplotlib on JASMIN to generate a plot. It also gives an important tip that may stop your code failing when run on the LOTUS cluster.

item.title: Additional software packages (under: /apps/jasmin/)
item.description: This article provides details of additional packages that exist under the /apps/jasmin/ directory which is available on all scientific analysis servers and on the LOTUS batch cluster on JASMIN.

item.title: JASMIN software changes: migration to CentOS7 (2020)
item.description: This article explains the changes in the provision of common software on JASMIN (“sci” servers and LOTUS) when upgrading to main operating system from RedHat Enterprise Linux 6 (RHEL6) to CentOS7.

item.title: Sharing software environments
item.description: This article explains how you can share software environments with other users on JASMIN. What is a software environment?   A software environment is typically a collection of files and directories associated with a set of environment variables that allows a given session to access them.
